metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10011 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
authfile.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not properly consider theeffects of realloc on buffer contents, which might allow local users toobtain sensitive private-key information by leveraging access to aprivilege-separated child process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.10
openssh-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.10
openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.10
ssh - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.10
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.10
ssh-krb5 - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.10').
